Context:
* The admission requirements vary based on the country of origin and the credential being pursued.
* Applicants need to select their country of origin and credential of interest using the "See Credential Requirements" dropdown tab to view specific requirements.
* The college does not have the capacity to admit all applicants who meet the minimum general and program-specific requirements.
* Programs can close early if international enrollment is achieved.
* Applicants must attach all required documents but should not send any extra documents.
* Copies of originals should be attested as "true copies" by the educational institution or a notary.
* Applicants under 18 must submit custodianship documents.
* The college reserves the right to request original documents if there are doubts about authenticity or legibility.
* Minimum scores are required for admission, which may change starting in January 2025.
* To register for the test, applicants need to apply for their academic program and receive an Admissions Test Letter.
* Not applicable to collaborative degree programs like Early Childhood Education (C118).
* Applicants from certain countries who do not meet George Brown's English language entry requirements may be offered a conditional acceptance subject to successful completion of level 8 or 9 of George Brown's English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program.
* Some countries are not eligible for a Letter of Acceptance to the George Brown College English for Academic Purposes Program (EAP) due to past experiences with Study Permit applicants being rejected by the Canadian visa office for a Study Permit when an ESL component is requested.
* For South Asian countries, it is highly recommended to submit official TOEFL scores instead.
* The test registration information can be found on georgebrown.ca/assessment.
* Some programs may have different English language entry requirements.
* There are no mentioned specific deadlines or dates in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Admission Requirements for International Students | George Brown College.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the English Language Proficiency requirements for applying to the EAP (English for Academic Purposes) program at George Brown College. Applicants are recommended to submit official TOEFL or IELTS scores, and the minimum score requirements vary depending on the test sections. The text also mentions that Duolingo scores will be accepted starting from September 2024 with different minimum score requirements. Students who suspend their studies for more than six consecutive 8-week sessions are required to retake the EAP level placement test or submit valid IELTS/TOEFL/Duolingo scores. The text lists the minimum score requirements for each test section for both TOEFL and IELTS, as well as the Duolingo requirements starting from September 2024. The text also mentions that some programs at George Brown College may not be eligible to receive conditional letters of acceptance (CLOA) and applicants must fulfill all academic, English proficiency, and additional divisional criteria to receive a direct letter of acceptance (LOA). Applicants are required to have studied full-time for at least two consecutive full academic years within the past four years where the medium of instruction was not English.

EXTRACTED INFORMATION:
- George Brown College EAP program requires official TOEFL or IELTS scores or Duolingo scores starting from September 2024.
- Minimum score requirements for each test section for TOEFL and IELTS (ranging from 10 to 120).
- Minimum score requirements for Duolingo starting from September 2024 (ranging from 25 to 135).
- Students who suspend studies for more than six consecutive 8-week sessions must retake the EAP level placement test or submit valid IELTS/TOEFL/Duolingo scores.
- Some programs at George Brown College may not be eligible for conditional letters of acceptance (CLOA), and applicants must fulfill all academic, English proficiency, and additional divisional criteria to receive a direct letter of acceptance (LOA).
- Applicants are required to have studied full-time for at least two consecutive full academic years within the past four years where the medium of instruction was not English.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Admission Requirements for International Students | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Applicants must have completed consecutive full academic years (high school or post-secondary), within the past four years in one of the following countries: Centennial.
* Applicants from eligible countries who do not meet George Brown's English language requirements may be offered conditional admission through their EAP program.
* Results for admissions tests are issued approximately 5 business days after testing.
* Placement assessments in English and/or Math are taken after accepting an offer of admission.
* Processing times for applications: we cannot provide exact processing times, but the current application processing time is approximately 3-4 weeks.
* We do not have the capacity to admit all applicants who meet minimum requirements, programs can close early if international enrollment is already achieved and there are no more places.
* Protected Persons, Refugee Claimants, or Convention Refugees require a study permit for education or training that is more than 6 months in duration.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Admission Requirements for International Students | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Students need a study permit for programs longer than 6 months at George Brown College.
* Application for study permit should be made after receiving an offer of admission.
* Study Permits are not issued inside Canada, apply online or at the nearest Canadian Embassy, High Commission or Consulate.
* Official information on requirements can be obtained from IRCC (Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada) office in Canada, a Canadian Embassy or Consulate overseas, and/or the IRCC website: <https://www.canada.ca/en/services/immigration-citizenship.html>
* George Brown College phone number: 416-415-2000
* TTY number: 1-877-515-5559
* Email address: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
* Visit Social Media Hub twice for the link.
* Information on the website is subject to change without notice.
* Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
